unnormalised: ## What are some simple things that everyday Indians can do to improve waste management in their communities?
normalised: ## What are some simple things that everyday Indians can do to improve waste management in their communities?

unnormalised: Okay, so we all complain about the garbage piling up, right? Especially after Diwali or Ganesh Chaturthi, it's like Mount Everest of waste outside our homes! But complaining doesn't solve anything. What *can* we actually *do*?
normalised: Okay, so we all complain about the garbage piling up, right? Especially after Diwali or Ganesh Chaturthi, it's like Mount Everest of waste outside our homes! But complaining does not solve anything. What can we actually do?

unnormalised: Firstly, **segregation at source, yaar!** Separate your wet waste (kitchen scraps) from dry waste (paper, plastic, metal). Municipalities like the ones in Mumbai and Pune are trying hard to implement this, but it only works if we cooperate. Imagine the difference if even half of us started doing this diligently!
normalised: Firstly, **segregation at source, yaar!** Separate your wet waste (kitchen scraps) from dry waste (paper, plastic, metal). Municipalities like the ones in Mumbai and Pune are trying hard to implement this, but it only works if we cooperate. Imagine the difference if even half of us started doing this diligently!

unnormalised: Secondly, **reduce, reuse, recycle!** It's an oldie but a goodie. Carry your own cloth bag when you go to the sabzi mandi like your Dadi used to! Instead of buying new, see if you can repair or repurpose old items. Donate clothes instead of throwing them away. Think "Lagaan" – remember how they reused everything!
normalised: Secondly, **reduce, reuse, recycle!** It's an oldie but a goodie. Carry your own cloth bag when you go to the sabzi mandi like your Dadi used to! Instead of buying new, see if you can repair or repurpose old items. Donate clothes instead of throwing them away. Think "Lagaan" – remember how they reused everything!

unnormalised: Thirdly, **composting!** If you have even a small balcony, you can compost your wet waste. It's surprisingly easy and the resulting compost is great for your plants. Think of it as free fertiliser! Institutions like TERI (The Energy and Resources Institute) offer workshops on home composting.

unnormalised: Finally, **be a conscious consumer.** Before buying something, ask yourself, "Do I *really* need this?" Packaging is a huge problem, so try to buy products with minimal packaging. Speak up to your local grocer if they are still using plastic bags.

unnormalised: Small steps by everyone can make a huge difference. Let's make India cleaner and greener, one garbage bin at a time!
